explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses deep learning models for detecting fraudulent financial activities, which is a subset of machine learning.
explanations.deep learning: The paper explicitly mentions deep learning (DL) and its application in financial services, including fraud detection.
explanations.classification: The paper involves training a Naive Bayes (NB) classifier for identifying transaction fraud, which is a classification task.
explanations.neural network: The proposed model includes a B-LSTM (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory) network, which is a type of neural network.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper uses a B-LSTM (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory) network as part of the composite sequence learning model.
explanations.LSTM: The paper specifically mentions LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) as part of the B-LSTM-NB model used for fraud detection.
